column4: How do i create a xorg.conf , i ran "Xorg -reconfigure" in the root term from recovery mode.. and still i don't fidn a xorg con file.. any clue ?
any one ?  HOw do i get a xorg.conf? I ran "sudo Xorg -configure" on a root terminal from recovery mode.. and still now use... i.e i do not find a xorg .conf on /etc/x11
that command creates the file in the current directory, you probably need to mv it to /etc/X11/xorg.conf (the name is different too)
what will be the default "current dir" on a root terminal ??? i.e i did not isue a cd
pwd will tell you
I am not on a root terminal now
do you understand what my question is ? :(
yes but im not sure you understand my answer, re-run the command to create the blank xorg.conf then type "pwd" to show you where you are , then mv that file to the correct place
ok
are you still there ?
pwd howed "/root"
so now, where is /root ?
are you there ?
I opened it
and i has xorg.conf.new
what must i do now ?
move it to etc /x11, If i move by renaming it xorg.conf . how do i make the ubuntu use that xorg.conf ?
it knows to use the file if you save it in /etc/X11/ as xorg.conf then restart X/your display manager.
you mean i have to move it and then restart or logout/login ?
login/out is fine, but if your X is already running/working im not sure what the point of creating an xorg.conf is
I editted and paste dmy xorg.conf onto /etc/x11
